summary: Lance W. Svendsen was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents list his name, position, and salary during this period, indicating his involvement in the committee's work related to the JFK assassination investigation. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll certifications suggests a continuous employment with the HSCA during the specified timeframe.
significance: Lance W. Svendsen's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in the provided documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his participation in the committee's activities.
